ACCEPT$MY_BTN;
You will get a bonus for every surviving crew member during the success screen.
Flashbangs can be destroyed after landing on the ground by shooting at them, or even by attacking them with a Melee weapon.
Some doors can be shot open by firing at their locks.
The ECM Feedback function of ECM Jammers regenerates every 4 minutes.
Some enemies use body armor and you need to aim for their heads.
Know your enemy. Cloakers have distinct green, glowing night vision goggles on, and make a noise when they're charging at you. You can also hear a static noise when they arrive at the scene.
ECM Jammers temporarily disable cameras. Don't be afraid to use one to blind the Camera Operator when you're in a tight spot.
Cameras can't detect noise, but they'll still sound the alarm if they see suspicious activity for too long.
If a camera sees suspicious activity, there's no stopping the alarm.
Melee weapons are always silent. If you don't have a suppressor, this is your best friend for silent takedowns.
When one of your teammates has been downed, ask the rest of your team to cover you while you revive him.
While sawing doors and deposit boxes is the fastest way to open them - it's also very loud. Use the silent motor to reduce its noise.
Hostages are your lifelines. Keep them secured, away from the action, and away from cops.
Trip mines can be placed anywhere, such as vents where Cloakers spawn, or a room you don't want cops to enter.
Be careful of tossing Grenades at cops. They can easily shoot it out of the air.
Shotguns can take down multiple cops in a single shot. Aim for a crowd and fire away.
Sniper Rifles can shoot through Shields and armor, and even multiple enemies.
Know your enemy. Tasers can be identified by their dark blue and yellow armor.
Know your enemy. The Snipers give away their position by their laser sights.
Know your enemy. The SWAT turret can be identified by being attached to a huge SWAT van.
The Shotgunner Skill Subtree provides massive boosts when using Shotguns.
The Oppressor Skill Subtree focuses boost your auto-fire weapons, making them even more effective.
Red outlines around an enemy during a Loud heist indicates that they are a Special Enemy of some sorts.
Bulldozers have a plate that protect their faces. You need to shoot away the plate before you can hand out headshots.
Mind your surroundings, if you kill a Civilian you will pay a penalty from your spending cash.
A Doctor Bag will refill your lives and a First Aid Kit will only refill your health.
If your teammates have been taken into custody you need a hostage or a dominated cop to be able to trade and get your teammate back.
You can't trade a hostage during an assault, you need to wait until the assault is over.
Watch out for Cloakers - they attack when you least expect it. So beware of their sound.
Guards will become suspicious about a destroyed camera. Civilians, on the other hand, don't care.
Play with your teammates and support them - on your own, you stand less of a chance to survive.
Cloakers are not affected by the Feedback Loop of an ECM Jammer.
Sniper Rifles can penetrate thin walls. Use this to your advantage.
Bulldozers can come charging at you when you least expect it. Stay on your toes.
Going for optional loot usually gives you more experience and money.
Getting kicked by a Cloaker or tased by Taser does not count towards your total amount times you are allowed to go down.
Remember a lone player is an easy target for Cloakers.
Using Feedback on an ECM Jammer can stun some cops in the vicinity for a short duration.
Almost every Stealth heist has a Camera Operator, be sure to kill him so cameras are no longer a problem.
ECM Jammers will block the guard's radios, civilian cellphones and cameras so they can't alert the cops to your presence while the ECM jammer is active.
Don't leave bodies around in Stealth, use a Body Bag to move them where they can't be seen.
Killing a guard in a cam room will let you freely roam without worrying about the cameras - but roaming guards still can detect you.
If you want to admire your weapon while in a heist, you can inspect it by pressing "INSPECT WEAPON" button.
Got a gadget? Turn it on by pressing the "GADGET ON/OFF" button.
On Crime.net you can bet your Offshore money for an "Offshore Payday".
Your weapons, skills, armor and Perk Deck all interact differently - take the time to read about their effects.
You can use the FBI files from the game menu to read about your teammates.
The game has several difficulty levels. Find one that fits you.
More loot means more rewards but could also mean higher risk.
Take a look at all the stats of a weapon. High damage is not always the most efficient depending on your playstyle.
Many weapons have an extended reload time if there are no bullets left in the magazine.
ZEAL units are the toughest that the DHS has to offer, and are deployed only at the Death Sentence difficulty.
You can select up to four preferred heisters, in case one of them is already taken by another player.
Skill points can be reallocated with no cost. Experiment and test for yourself.
It is better to have multiple Skill Sets that are good at different things, than to have one Skill Set that tries to do a bit of everything.
Double the fun. Use Akimbo weapons to wield two pistols or SMGs.
Visit the FBI files to read about the Payday Gang, Special Enforcers and the Heists.
Heister Tip
The Butcher's Gun Trade business reaches all around the globe. She has her eyes on one-of-a-kind weaponry to steal and she knows how to settle a score.
Scarface is proud of his Cuban origins even though he often professes his dislike of the island.
Scarface spends a fortune on furniture and decorations.
John Wick really likes his car.
John Wick is sometimes called Baba Yaga, after a Slavic folklore figure.
Bain spends a fortune on bribes and informants.
Everyone knows Bain's name. No one knows his identity.
Dallas is the informal leader of the Payday Gang.
Wolf used to work as a game developer in Sweden.
Chains is sometimes in a pickle.
Houston spends a fortune on cars.
Houston thinks Hoxton is an idiot.
Bonnie spends a fortune on whisky.
Bonnie probably gambles too much. But it wouldn't be safe to tell her that.
Captain Winters used to be in the Military Police before he joined GenSec.
Rust spends a fortune on his bike.
Rust would probably kill anyone who damaged his bike.
Sokol spends a fortune on ice hockey gear.
Sokol still maintains the physique of a professional athlete.
Sokol enjoys the fact that he still has fans in Russia from his ice hockey days.
Aldstone spends a fortune on specially imported tea.
Aldstone's first name is unknown to all the heisters except Hoxton, who never uses it.
Aldstone doesn't like Hoxton's choice of profession, but as a loyal and professional butler he stoically accepts it.
Gage doesn't like everything about his job, but he does have a passion for the merchandise.
Gage is often underestimated, something which he uses to his advantage.
Bob McKendrick spends a fortune on influence-peddling.
Bob McKendrick is not to be underestimated.
Bodhi despises Tasers. Try shooting one with the Platypus Sniper Rifle when playing as him.
The Classics. These jobs were the biggest things the gang's ever done. Let's say we see if they still have what it takes?
